events.message: The policyholder reported a car collision that occurred on a busy urban street involving another vehicle. Initial details were provided to start the claim process.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident due to reported vehicle collision and damage to the insured car.
An insurance agent specialized in auto claims was assigned to the case to ensure prompt and efficient handling of the accident details.
The claimant received official acknowledgment of the submitted claim along with contact information for ongoing support.
The insurance provider requested additional documents including police reports, photos from the accident scene, and vehicle repair estimates.
The policyholder submitted all required documentation as requested, including detailed accident photographs and the official police accident report.
The claims investigation team began their assessment of the vehicle damage and liability based on submitted evidence and documentation.
The investigation concluded confirming the circumstances of the collision and verifying the extent of damage to the insured vehicle.
An initial settlement offer was presented to the claimant based on repair costs and policy coverage limits established during the investigation.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the prompt communication and clarity of the settlement offer during the feedback call.
Final approval of the claim was granted confirming the amount of settlement and authorizing the next payment steps.
The approved settlement payment was processed and issued to the claimantâ€™s designated bank account as per agreement.
The claim case was officially closed after confirming that all payments were completed and there were no outstanding issues.
All claim documents and records were securely archived in the insurance system for future reference and compliance purposes.
